meanings.definition: Suitable or right for a particular situation; timely.
meanings.sent1: The opportune moment to ask for help is when you truly need it.
meanings.sent2: Her arrival at the party was quite opportune, just as the cake was being served.
meanings.sent3: It was quite opportune that the cat chose to knock over the vase just as the family was leaving for vacation.
meanings.sent4: The opportune rain shower saved the farmer's crops from drying out completely.
meanings.sent5: The opportune arrival of the fire truck prevented the house from burning down completely.

meanings.definition: Happening at a favorable time; well-timed.
meanings.sent1: The opportune opportunity to showcase her talent came during the talent show.
meanings.sent2: His decision to invest in the company turned out to be quite opportune as it grew rapidly.
meanings.sent3: It was quite opportune that the ice cream truck arrived just as the sun came out.
meanings.sent4: The opportune arrival of the bus saved her from walking in the rain.
meanings.sent5: The opportune discovery of the hidden treasure brought joy to the entire village.
